alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 2:00AM MST until November 16 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 4 inches, with the highest amounts expected over high plains of Glacier County and the Bear`s Paw and Little Belt Mountains. Winds may gust as high as 35 mph at times. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibility due to snow and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and snow will initially develop this evening before changing to all snow as temperatures fall into the 20s and northerly winds gust over 25 mph at times tonight. Wet roadways will become icy and slippery.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
